tasks.task: Preparing for a hurricane as a farmer
subtasks: Fill 5-gallon buckets and other containers with water
Mulch bare rows in the greenhouse to prevent erosion and wind damage
Minimize soil splashing into crop canopy by mulching
Rib mature crops like tomatoes and melons to prevent splitting
Pick coconuts and harvest cut flowers before the storm
Fortify field trellises to support crops
Unhang trellis plants and lay them flat on the ground
Secure tractors and other equipment and supplies
Store market baskets, picking crates, dip tape, and irrigation pipes indoors
Stock up on gas for farm equipment
Water transplants with collected water if power is lost
Assess damage to crops and equipment
Repair fortifications and trellises
Replant any damaged transplants
Clean up debris and repair irrigation systems
Assess damage to crops and equipment
Fortify old trellises and make repairs where necessary
Check if replanting is needed for damaged transplants
Clean up debris around the farm
Repair irrigation systems and reassemble any broken equipment

tasks.task: Preparing for a hurricane as a farmer
MAINTASK: Preparing for a hurricane as a farmer
subtasks: Fill 5-gallon buckets and other containers with water
Mulch as many bare rows as possible to prevent erosion and wind damage
Minimize soil splashing into crop canopy by mulching
Rib mature crops like tomatoes and melons to prevent splitting
Pick coconuts and harvest cut flowers before the storm
Fortify field trellises to support crops
Unhang trellis plants and lay them flat on the ground
Secure tractors and other equipment and supplies
Store market baskets, picking crates, dip tape, and irrigation pipes indoors
Stock up on gas for generators and other farm equipment
Assess damage to crops and equipment
Repair fortifications and trellises
Replant any damaged transplants
Clean up debris and repair irrigation systems
